org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing
Class TimingTargetAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing.TimingTargetAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
TimingTarget
@ThreadSafe(implementationOnly=true)
public class TimingTargetAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements TimingTarget

Implements the TimingTarget interface, providing stubs for all timing target methods. Subclasses may extend this adapter rather than implementing the TimingTarget interface if they only care about a subset of the events provided. For example, sequencing animations may only require monitoring the TimingTarget.end(org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing.Animator) method, so subclasses of this adapter may ignore the other methods such as timingEvent.

This class provides a useful "debug" name via setDebugName(String) and getDebugName(). The debug name is also output by toString(). This feature is intended to aid debugging.

Author:
Chet Haase, Tim Halloran

Method Detail

begin

public void begin(Animator source)
Description copied from interface: TimingTarget
Called once when the animation begins. This provides a chance for targets to perform any setup required at animation start time.

This is always the first call made to any timing target.

Specified by:
begin in interface TimingTarget
Parameters:
source - the animation.

end

public void end(Animator source)
Description copied from interface: TimingTarget
Called once when the animation ends.

This is always the last call made to any timing target.

Specified by:
end in interface TimingTarget
Parameters:
source - the animation.

cancel

public void cancel(Animator source)
Specified by:
cancel in interface TimingTarget

repeat

public void repeat(Animator source)
Description copied from interface: TimingTarget
Called when the animation repeats the animation cycle. This method will be invoked Animator.getRepeatCount() - 1 times, unless Animator.getRepeatCount() == Animator.INFINITE in which case it will be invoked until the animation is manually stopped.

Specified by:
repeat in interface TimingTarget
Parameters:
source - the animation.

reverse

public void reverse(Animator source)
Description copied from interface: TimingTarget
Called when a running animation is reversed via Animator.reverseNow(). This method is not invoked when Animator.startReverse() is called—it is only used as a notification when a running animation is reversed.

Specified by:
reverse in interface TimingTarget
Parameters:
source - the animation.

timingEvent

public void timingEvent(Animator source,
                        double fraction)
Description copied from interface: TimingTarget
This method will receive all of the timing events during an animation. The fraction is the percent elapsed (0 to 1) of the current animation cycle.

Specified by:
timingEvent in interface TimingTarget
Parameters:
source - the animation.
fraction - the fraction of completion between the start and end of the current cycle. Note that on reversing cycles ( Animator.Direction.BACKWARD) the fraction decreases from 1.0 to 0 on backwards-running cycles. Note also that animations with a duration of INFINITE will have an undefined value for the fraction, since there is no fraction that makes sense if the animation has no defined length.
